required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Intra-articular Injection of Autologous Protein Solution ("APS(TM)") for the Treatment of Osteoarthritis (OA)
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Single-Center Clinical Study of a Single Intra-Articular Injection of Autologous Protein Solution ("APS(TM)") in Patients With Osteoarthritis (OA) of the Knee

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective single-center study will evaluate the safety and tolerability of a single dose of "APS(TM)" treated patients with OA of the knee who have failed conservative OA therapy. The study will also evaluate efficacy by assessing patient pain and functionality.

primary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability will be assessed from AEs and injection-site reactions, physical examinations, knee examinations, vital signs, ECGs, and clinical laboratory tests (hematology, coagulation, blood chemistry, and urinalysis) evaluated at baseline (pre-injection) and post-injection up to 6 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Using Rescue Medication
secondary_outcome.description: Explore the potential for an analgesic effect of a single dose of APS in patients with OA of the knee.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, and at Months 1, 3, and 6.
secondary_outcome.description: The Western Ontario and McMaster Universities osteoarthritis index questionnaire using the Likert scale (WOMAC LK), Version 3.1 questionnaire has 24 items that the patient addresses about the knee: 5 items on the pain subscale, 2 on the stiffness subscale, and 17 on the physical function subscale. Each item was to be answered on a 5-point Likert scale, with grading from 0 (none or never) to 4 (extreme or always). The scores are summed for items in each subscale, with possible ranges as follows: pain=0-20, stiffness=0-8, physical function=0-68. A higher score indicates worse pain, stiffness, or functional limitation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, and at Months 1, 3, and 6.
secondary_outcome.description: Changed Outcome Measure Description to: The Western Ontario and McMaster Universities osteoarthritis index questionnaire using the Likert scale (WOMAC LK), Version 3.1 questionnaire has 24 items that the patient addresses about the knee: 5 items on the pain subscale, 2 on the stiffness subscale, and 17 on the physical function subscale. Each item was to be answered on a 5-point Likert scale, with grading from 0 (none or never) to 4 (extreme or always). The scores are summed for items in each subscale, with possible ranges as follows: pain=0-20, stiffness=0-8, physical function=0-68. A higher score indicates worse pain, stiffness, or functional limitation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, and at Months 1, 3, and 6.
secondary_outcome.description: Changed Outcome Measure Description to: The Western Ontario and McMaster Universities osteoarthritis index questionnaire using the Likert scale (WOMAC LK), Version 3.1 questionnaire has 24 items that the patient addresses about the knee: 5 items on the pain subscale, 2 on the stiffness subscale, and 17 on the physical function subscale. Each item was to be answered on a 5-point Likert scale, with grading from 0 (none or never) to 4 (extreme or always). The scores are summed for items in each subscale, with possible ranges as follows: pain=0-20, stiffness=0-8, physical function=0-68. A higher score indicates worse pain, stiffness, or functional limitation.

arm_group.description: Patients who have been treated with a single, intra-articular injection.

intervention.description: A therapy prepared at the point-of-care from a small sample of the patient's own blood containing high concentrations of anti-inflammatory and anabolic proteins

criteria.textblock:
Eligibility Criteria:
- Male or female ≥40 years.
- Willingness and ability to comply with the study procedures and visit schedules and ability to follow verbal and written instructions.
- A standing radiograph of the knee showing a Kellgren grade of 2 or 3
- Frequency of knee pain on most days over the last month.
- Diagnosis of unilateral knee OA
- Body mass index (BMI) ≤40 kg/m2.
- Failed conservative OA therapy.
- Signed an independent ethics committee (IEC)-approved informed consent form (ICF).
- Willingness to abstain from the use of topical pain therapies, intra-articular corticosteroids, and viscosupplementation during the study.
- Willingness to abstain from systemic pain medications except rescue medication.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Single-centre study in the Netherlands. FPI April 2013.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All patients treated with APS who had at least 1 post-injection assessment of clinical outcomes were to be included in the clinical outcomes population, which was used for the clinical outcomes summaries and listings

group.title: Autologous Protein Solution "APS(TM)"
group.description: Patients who have been treated with a single, intra-articular injection. Autologous Protein Solution "APS(TM)": A therapy prepared at the point-of-care from a small sample of the patient's own blood containing high concentrations of anti-inflammatory and anabolic proteins

participants_list.participants: Withdrawal of one subject after one-month assessment due to persistent OA symptoms

group.title: Autologous Protein Solution "APS(TM)"
group.description: Patients who have been treated with a single, intra-articular injection. Autologous Protein Solution "APS(TM)": A therapy prepared at the point-of-care from a small sample of the patient's own blood containing high concentrations of anti-inflammatory and anabolic proteins

outcome.title: Number of Adverse Events
outcome.description: Safety and tolerability will be assessed from AEs and injection-site reactions, physical examinations, knee examinations, vital signs, ECGs, and clinical laboratory tests (hematology, coagulation, blood chemistry, and urinalysis) evaluated at baseline (pre-injection) and post-injection up to 6 months.
outcome.population: In cases where a patient reported multiple occurrences of an AE, the first occurrence of the worst reported case of the event was to be used for the purpose of analysis.

group.title: Autologous Protein Solution "APS(TM)"
group.description: Patients who have been treated with a single, intra-articular injection. Autologous Protein Solution "APS(TM)": A therapy prepared at the point-of-care from a small sample of the patient's own blood containing high concentrations of anti-inflammatory and anabolic proteins

measure.title: Number of Adverse Events
measure.description: Safety and tolerability will be assessed from AEs and injection-site reactions, physical examinations, knee examinations, vital signs, ECGs, and clinical laboratory tests (hematology, coagulation, blood chemistry, and urinalysis) evaluated at baseline (pre-injection) and post-injection up to 6 months.
measure.population: In cases where a patient reported multiple occurrences of an AE, the first occurrence of the worst reported case of the event was to be used for the purpose of analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Patients Using Rescue Medication
outcome.description: Explore the potential for an analgesic effect of a single dose of APS in patients with OA of the knee.
outcome.population: The incidence of patients using rescue medication for OA pain.

group.title: Autologous Protein Solution "APS(TM)"
group.description: Patients who have been treated with a single, intra-articular injection. Autologous Protein Solution "APS(TM)": A therapy prepared at the point-of-care from a small sample of the patient's own blood containing high concentrations of anti-inflammatory and anabolic proteins

measure.title: Number of Patients Using Rescue Medication
measure.description: Explore the potential for an analgesic effect of a single dose of APS in patients with OA of the knee.
measure.population: The incidence of patients using rescue medication for OA pain.
measure.units: Frequency of Patients using Rescue medic

outcome.title: Pain Score
outcome.description: The Western Ontario and McMaster Universities osteoarthritis index questionnaire using the Likert scale (WOMAC LK), Version 3.1 questionnaire has 24 items that the patient addresses about the knee: 5 items on the pain subscale, 2 on the stiffness subscale, and 17 on the physical function subscale. Each item was to be answered on a 5-point Likert scale, with grading from 0 (none or never) to 4 (extreme or always). The scores are summed for items in each subscale, with possible ranges as follows: pain=0-20, stiffness=0-8, physical function=0-68. A higher score indicates worse pain, stiffness, or functional limitation.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, and at Months 1, 3, and 6.
outcome.population: Results of the WOMAC LK 3.1 questionnaire (pain, stiffness, and functionality subscores) were summarized by timepoint.

group.title: Autologous Protein Solution "APS(TM)"
group.description: Patients who have been treated with a single, intra-articular injection. Autologous Protein Solution "APS(TM)": A therapy prepared at the point-of-care from a small sample of the patient's own blood containing high concentrations of anti-inflammatory and anabolic proteins

measure.title: Pain Score
measure.description: The Western Ontario and McMaster Universities osteoarthritis index questionnaire using the Likert scale (WOMAC LK), Version 3.1 questionnaire has 24 items that the patient addresses about the knee: 5 items on the pain subscale, 2 on the stiffness subscale, and 17 on the physical function subscale. Each item was to be answered on a 5-point Likert scale, with grading from 0 (none or never) to 4 (extreme or always). The scores are summed for items in each subscale, with possible ranges as follows: pain=0-20, stiffness=0-8, physical function=0-68. A higher score indicates worse pain, stiffness, or functional limitation.
measure.population: Results of the WOMAC LK 3.1 questionnaire (pain, stiffness, and functionality subscores) were summarized by timepoint.
measure.units: Scores on a WOMAC pain scale

The scores are summed for items in each subscale, with possible ranges as follows: pain=0-20, stiffness=0-8, physical function=0-68. reported_events.time_frame: AEs were recorded at each visit (Week 1, Week 2, Month 1, Month 3, Month 6)
reported_events.desc: In cases where a patient reported multiple occurrences of an AE, the first occurrence of the worst reported case of the event was to be used for the purpose of analysis.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Small sample size Unblinded observational study
